page.title: 12HOUSING IN THE BEXTON AREA
page.content: THERE ARE TWO MAIN TYPES OF HOUSING.FIRSTLY,THERE ARE THREE ESTATES,CONSISTING MAINLY OF THREE AND FOUR BEDROOMED DETACHED HOUSES AND BUNGALOWS.THERE ARE A FEW SEMI-DETACHED HOUSES.ALL THE GARDENS ARE OPEN-PLAN,SO THERE ARE NO FENCES AT THE FRONT.ALL THE HOUSES ARE PRIVATELY OWNED. SECONDLY,THERE ARE MANY DETACHED,INDIVIDUALLY DESIGNED HOUSES,THE LARGEST OF THESE ARE ON TOFT ROAD.MANY CANNOT BE SEEN FROM THE TREE-LINED ROAD.SOME OF THE HOUSES ARE VERY UNUSUAL.THEY WERE DESIGNED BY RICHARD HARDING WATT,WHO ESPECIALLY LIKED ITALIAN ARCHITECTURE.SOME OF THESE HOUSES HAVE BEEN PULLED DOWN AND REPLACED WITH NEWER ONES. BRAE COTTAGE WAS BUILT FOR SIR HENRY ROYCE.IT WAS WHILE HE WAS LIVING HERE THAT HE MET CHARLES ROLLS.
